    Confidence interval of the mean under a Simple Random Sampling framework

    cx_srs.Rd

    Confidence interval of the mean under a Simple Random Sampling framework

    cx_srs(C, E, x_est, sd_exp, n_real, sd_est, parameter = FALSE, N = Inf)

    Arguments

    C

    Level of confidence. (0 <= C <= 1)

    E

    Sampling error. (E > 0)

    x_est

    Sample mean

    sd_exp

    Expected standard deviation (s_exp > 0)

    n_real

    Real sample size (n_real > 0)

    sd_est

    Sample standar deviation (s_est > 0)

    parameter

    Type TRUE if you do know the populations sd, type FALSE (default) if it is an estimate.

    N

    A positive integer indicating the number of elements in the population. By default, infinite.

    Value

    The function returns the interval of confidence of the population mean, and information regarding the sufficiency of the sample size.

    Examples

    cx_srs(C = 0.95, E = 50, x_est = 3500, sd_est = 200, n_real = 250, sd_exp = 200)
#> With 95% confidence, the population mean is between 3475.208 and 3524.792 
#> Your sample size: 250 
#> Needed sample size: 62 
#> Your sample size seems to be sufficient.
cx_srs(C = 0.95, E = 50, x_est = 3500, sd_est = 400, n_real = 400, sd_exp = 200)
#> With 95% confidence, the population mean is between 3460.801 and 3539.199 
#> Your sample size: 400 
#> Needed sample size: 62 
#> Your sample size seems to be sufficient.
cx_srs(C = 0.95, E = 50, x_est = 3500, sd_est = 400,
        n_real = 250, sd_exp = 200, parameter = TRUE, N = 5000)
#> With 95% confidence, the population mean is between 3451.667 and 3548.333 
#> Your sample size: 250 
#> Needed sample size: 61 
#> Your sample size seems to be sufficient.
